page.title: 01The Area Around Beetham
page.content: Beetham is a rural area of gently undulating pasture land on the southern fringe of the Lake District.The Bela River is a minor tributary of the River Kent, flowing through the area to the Kent Estuary. The village of Beetham is situated on the A6 and River Bela.The hamlet of Slackhead is a continuation of Beetham village rising westward through native woodland and the limestone pavement of Haverbrack. In Prehistoric Times the whole area was below the sea and some of the limestone on which it lies is rich in fossil shells. The site has been occupied since Iron Age Times. The Saxons used the waterfall to work the Cornmill.
